project
Class View

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      project.View
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class View
extends javax.swing.JFrame

This class is the view This is what the user sees and can interact with All of the objects that can be seen by the user are stored here Or at least are extanisated here

Version:
4.3
Author:
Anthony Scata
See Also:
Serialized Form

addLabel

public AMLabel addLabel(Hierarchy hierarchy,
                        int level,
                        java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String id,
                        java.lang.String its_parent)
This creates a label to be added to a panel in a specific level

Parameters:
hierarchy - - defines which hierarchy the label's will be added to
level - - Its level with the hierarchy, 1, 2 or 3
name - - The text to be used for the label
id - - The unique id of the label
its_parent - - the parent id for this label
Returns:
- the Label that was created

addLabel

public void addLabel(int this_level,
                     AMLabel label,
                     Hierarchy this_hierarchy)
This actually adds the label First we need to check that the label will be placed in the correct position Level 1 labels at the top Level 2 labels on the second row Level 3 labels from row 3 - max rows

Parameters:
this_level - - Which level in the hierarchy it will be added to
label - - The label to be added
this_hierarchy - - The hierarchy that the label will be added to

Find which hierarchy an element will be added to or is in

Parameters:
hierarchy_num - - the hierarchy number, starting from 0
Returns:
- the hierarchy in that position

Parameters:

new_value - - The new value to be placed at that key

lookANDfeel

public void lookANDfeel(int look)
This sets the look and feel of the view This is a global setting and will change the look of every GUI element inside the window

look - - the look we want as an integer

bar_edit

public void bar_edit(double count,
                     Hierarchy hierarchy,
                     AMLabel label)
Setup the bar with new information This method is required as we now have information to add into the bar that we previously didn't have Also used to change the count of the bar when we decide to count a different category

Parameters:
count - - The count for this bar
hierarchy - - that the bar belongs to
label - - The label that the bar belongs to
left_padding - - The padding to be added to the left of the bar for consistent spacing

decideSpace

public java.awt.Insets decideSpace(double count,
                                   float largest,
                                   float panel_width,
                                   int left_padding,
                                   AMLabel bar)
Decide the external padding that is required for this object to be properly spaced The bar size should be relative to its size and to the largest The largest bar should reach all the way to the other side of the panel

Parameters:
count - - The count for the label
largest - - The largest to be compared with
panel_width - - The width of the panel above the bar
left_padding - - The padding to be added
bar - - The bar itself
Returns:
- the inset that has the padding added to it

clearAll

public void clearAll()
Clear all of the panels with information Also clear the corresponding information box We can only clear the panels if they are not locked

public void hide_show_panel(javax.swing.JLabel label,

Hide or show a hierarchy depending on the label where the interaction started If we hide the panel we want the other elements to be smaller to save space When showing the panel it should be set back

Parameters:
label - - the label that was interacted with
visible - - if we want it to be visible or not
